SEARCH
Package chessapi4j

Class Util

java.lang.Object
chessapi4j.Util
public class Util extends Object
Utility class to avoid boilerplate code. Not all of these class methods are safe, be careful.
Since:
1.0.0
Author:
lunalobos

  • Field Details

    • QUEEN_MEGAMATRIX

      public static final int[][][] QUEEN_MEGAMATRIX
      This matrix contains all the information about queen's movements. The idea is that the first index corresponds to the square and the second one to the direction and sense (MoveDirection ordinal order ). After calling these two, we obtain an array of the squares to which the queen can move if the board is empty in progressive order (without the initial square).

    • QUEEN_DIRECTIONS

      public static final int[] QUEEN_DIRECTIONS
      This array indicates the directions in which the queen can move according to the ordinal indices of the MoveDirection enum class.

    • BISHOP_DIRECTIONS

      public static final int[] BISHOP_DIRECTIONS
      This array indicates the directions in which the bishop can move according to the ordinal indices of the MoveDirection enum class.

    • ROOK_DIRECTIONS

      public static final int[] ROOK_DIRECTIONS
      This array indicates the directions in which the rook can move according to the ordinal indices of the MoveDirection enum class.

    • isPromotion

      public static boolean isPromotion(Square targetSquare)
      Promotion checker for the given target square. This method returns true if the given square is in the 1st or 8th row.

      This method doesn't work for relative promotions based on a specific side; it simply checks the row.

      Parameters:
      targetSquare -
      Returns:
      true if it is a promotion square
      Since:
      1.2.3

    • getSquareIndex

      public static int getSquareIndex(String square)
      Square number for the given square in algebraic notation.

      WARNING: If the input string is not a valid square, the behavior of this function is unpredictable and may result in fatal exceptions.

      For a secure functionality, resort to the method getSquareIndex(Square).

      Parameters:
      square -
      Returns:
      square number for the given square in algebraic notation

    • getColIndex

      public static int getColIndex(String column)
      Column number for the given column character

      If the input string is not a valid column, the result will be less than 0.

      Parameters:
      column - the column name (a, b, c, ... , h)
      Returns:
      the column number for the given column character

    • isInCheck

      public static boolean isInCheck(Position position)
      True if the position is in check false otherwise.

      WARNING: If the position inserted is not a valid position, the behavior of this method is undefined and may result in fatal exceptions.

      Parameters:
      position - the position to check for a check
      Returns:
      true if the position is in check false otherwise
